runs.comm: length ball on middle stump, straightens a touch, and he comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on and they sprint through for a single
back of a length outside off, chopped into the ground and towards Dilshan at backward point
slower ball, full outside off, can't beat cover with his drive

shot. Did an AB de Villiers-esque back-and-across jump way before the bowler delivered. He sent down a slower ball outside off, and Shehzad responded by getting down low and scooping it over the covers, with the angle
back of a length, a touch too straight. Works it off his hips to short fine leg, who misfields to allow them to run two
this time he sets himself up by taking a step away from his stumps, and the bowler's response is a bouncer that he can only duck under
angles this across Muktar, who plays for the turn, looking to drive through mid-off, and it goes straight on and beats his outside edge
straighter, attacking the batsman's feet. Clipped back to the bowler
very full on middle stump, in the blockhole, jabbed to extra cover

ooh, just clears mid-off. It was too full to get the elevation he wanted, and he cleared his front leg and used his wrists to get it over the fielder. Just about succeeds, Kapugedera was leaping at full stretch
on the pads now, worked to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off, and Kapugedera's fumble makes it easier to complete the single
length ball angling across, offcutter, and it beats the batsman, who clears his front
another offcutter, fuller and straighter, and that sends the bails flying after Shehzad misses another across-the-line
and he starts with a bang. Gets a short, wide one, and he stands up and cuts it fiercely to the left of backward point. Times it crisply and it beats third man as well, by a good distance
slower ball on middle stump, comes forward and nudges it gently into the leg side
bouncer, goes for the hook, has to play it from over his right shoulder, and ends up top-edging high in the air. Easy catch for Kapugedera at deep midwicket
slower ball on the pads, clipped away through backward square leg
length ball outside off, a bit of extra bounce beats Hafeez's angled-bat drive
shuffles across early, and ends up cramping himself for room. Length ball, punched to point
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Looks to steer it with an open face, can't beat point
another slower ball, straighter this time, comes in a touch and Hafeez defends into the off side
length ball on middle stump, tucked away to the right of mid-on
length ball outside off, and that's nicely driven by Malik, on the up, gets it into the gap between short cover and mid-off
slower ball on middle stump, worked away to deep backward square leg

short ball, and Hafeez swivels into a firm pull. The man at deep square leg, Jayasuriya, dives to his right to cut it off and sends in a powerful flat throw to the keeper's end, forcing Hafeez to dive to complete his second
slower ball on middle stump, clipped away to deep square leg
bouncer, and that is some seriously steep lift. Over Malik's head, and clears the leaping keeper as well
slower ball on middle and off, tucked away to the right of midwicket
another slower ball, on the stumps, clipped towards midwicket
back of a length on off stump, guided down to third man
back of a length, angling into middle stump, clipped off the back foot towards mid-on

back of a length, slower ball on off stump, punched to the right of point, and Hafeez left his crease at the non-striker's end, thinking it had beaten the fielder. It was Dilshan, though, and he's electric. Makes a diving stop and quickly fires a throw to the bowler's end, while he's still on his knees, and Perera deflected it onto the stumps and finds Hafeez short of his crease
another slower ball, fourth-stump line this time, and he opens his bat face and steers it down to third man
fuller now, outside off, big stride forward to drive to cover
fullish again, driven on the up to cover

full outside off, comes forward and opens his bat face to push it to the right of Dilshan. Far enough from him to pick up a single, and his throw to the bowler's end is deflected away from the fielder backing up on the leg side, allowing another run, and then there's an extra overthrow when the deep midwicket fielder sends in a lazy throw to the batsman's end
tossed up on leg stump, slog-swept to deep midwicket
on the pads, tu
quickish and full on off stump, punched back to the bowler
down the track and Siriwardana shortens his length. Plays for the turn and it goes with the angle to hit him on the pad

gone, Pakistan are five down! Came down the track again and again he shortened his length. It was quick, angling in, and a long way short of Malik. The previous ball seemed to confuse Malik, and he ended up playing inside the line. It turns sharply past his outside edge, and Kusal completes an easy stumping
short ball on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
flat, angling into leg stump, pulled away to deep midwicket
quick and flat again, fuller this time, clipped away towards short fine leg
tossed up outside off, presses forward and pokes it into the covers
short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
flat, this one slides on towards off stump, clipped with the angle to long-on
tossed up outside off, presses forward and pushes it towards point
flat, short, slides on towards middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket
ooh. Another slider, not short enough to pull. Bottom-edges it between his legs, to short fine leg
a bit of flight outside off, driven to sweeper cover
makes room again, drives the length ball on the up to sweeper cover
down the track now, drives inside-out into the covers
short ball and that is four. A bit of width too, and he slapped it hard, beat the man at point, diving to his right, and it went racing to the boundary behind him
another short ball, and that has disappeared. Opened his body up and swung his hips through the pull, smashed it over deep midwicket
full on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
flat, a bit fuller than Rizwan anticipated as he went back to punch. Went with the angle, cramped him, and he had to block it back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away towards long leg
short ball, angling in, and Afridi has just whipped that off his hips, high and hard over deep backward square leg, into the stands
back of a length outside off and that's nicely played, let it come on and guided it to the left of third man
back of a length outside off, and again Afridi guides it down to third man
short ball, gets steep bounce on it, and Rizwan does well to roll his wrists over to keep the pull down. Played that from around head height, sent it rolling down to deep backward square leg
tossed up loopily outside off, driven to deep cover
short ball, and Afridi just clears his front leg and swivels around to pull it over the square leg boundary
full on leg stump, clipped to wide long-on
full on off stump, and that's nicely played by Rizwan, presses forward and pushes it softly into the off side. The bowler has to run to his left to field that, easy single in the end
another short ball, another six. Slides on, i
full on middle stump, gets his front leg out of the way to drive, but straight to the bowler
in the blockhole on middle stump, driven to long-off
full outside off, and that is wristy from Afridi, whips it away past the diving midwicket fielder, and Kapugedera has to sprint to his right at full tilt from long-on and dive to save the boundary
overpitched on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg
low full-toss on the legs, clipped to deep square leg
full outside off, driven firmly but straight to extra cover
full on off stump, whipped to long-on
starts with a full-toss, and Rizwan swipes it away to the deep backward square leg boundary

slower ball outside off, quite full. Gets down on one knee to sweep into the leg side, doesn't time it too well, but that serves his purposes well, since it means deep midwicket has to come in a long way, and they get an easy two
bowled him! It's a slower ball again, very full, and he took a step out of his crease and ended up yorking himself. Huge backlift, went for a whip over the leg side, ended up playing all around it
another slower ball, comes down the track to meet it on the full, drives it to long-on
low full-toss, follows Afridi as he backs away to make room. Plays a quiet, straight-bat checked drive to long-off
shot! Another full-toss, low but not so low as to be unhittable. Shuffles across and crouches down to lap-sweep it casually to the left of short fine leg

and he's bowled him! Fired it flat, across the batsman, and Afridi cleared his front leg and looked to slog-sweep him into orbit. The ball slid on with the angle, beat his bat, and clipped the outside of off stump
very full on off and middle, driven inside-out to the right of sweeper cover
low full-toss, flat and quick on middle stump, swiped down to long-on
flat, angling into off stump. Imad clears his front leg and smacks it hard down the ground, but straight to the bowler
a little shorter, and he makes room to slap it to deep point
full and flat on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
sees him making room to hit through the off side and follows him, a long way outside leg stump, hits him on the pads with a very full ball

sees him shaping to reverse-sweep and bowls it full outside leg. Misses the ball, not called wide because the batsman had made the premeditated move before the bowler released. But I'm not sure he changed his grip.
in the blockhole on middle and leg, clears his front leg and drags it down to long-on
yorker on middle and off, clears his front leg and drives to long-off
flat and full on off stump, driven down the ground, to the right of long-on

flat, angled across Anwar, and that is powerful. It was a length ball, and it was pitched outside off, and though it was quick, that gave him the swinging room to get down on one knee and slog-sweep over deep midwicket
yorker now, dug out through backward square leg
down the track comes Imad, meets it on the full, slaps it over the top towards deep cover, who misfields and permits them to run the second run easier than it intially seemed
full-toss down the leg side, and Anwar is down on one knee in a flash to swing that over deep backward square leg

took a big back and across step, deep in his crease, and though it was flat and quick and full, he had made himself a bit of swinging room, given himself leverage to swipe it hard and flat into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
very full outside leg, smacks Imad on the pad as his head falls over while trying to flick
slower ball, back of the hand, very well bowled. Looked to make room to slap through the off side, missed, and the ball looped over the leg bail and rolled down to the keeper
another full-toss, down the leg side, and Anwar has absolutely hammered that. Just opened his front leg up and swung it away over deep square leg
goes deep in his crease again with that big back-and-across step, and Perera bowls a full-toss outside off. Swipes hard, and again he bisects that gap between long-on and deep midwicket
another slower ball, follows Anwar as he backs away to make room. Swings at it, looking to hit through the off side, misses it, and it runs away past leg stump
there's that big back and across step. Perera bowls another slower ball, and Anwar pulls it down towards long leg
gets his yorker slightly wrong, gives Anwar just enough hitting room. It's angling into him, and he opens up and absolutely smashes it over midwicket
back of a length slower ball and he goes back and across and works it to long leg. The fielder comes in, misfields, and Anwar gets an easy two
low full-toss outside leg stump, and you do not bowl those to Anwar. Opens up his body and uses his wrists this time to find the gap at deep backward square leg
another twist. Late, late twist. Slower ball outside off, and Anwar, who looks to swing that over the leg side, ends up getting a thin outside edge through to the keeper
slower ball angling away from Tanvir, who comes forward and pushes it gently into the cover point region and picks up a single

full and wide, comes forward and pokes it down to long-off. They take on Thisara's arm, go for a second, and it's proved to be a suicidal second. Good throw, straight over the stumps, and Malinga has the bails off quickly to have the diving Tanvir out by a good six inches
slower ball on off stump and Irfan leans forward and squeezes the ball into the covers and gets off strike
down the track, it's a slower ball, and Imad has finished with a six! It was angling in, right into the slot for him to swing cleanly through the line and launch that over long-on
